description: Information about the cell line or cell culture biomaterial.
title: Cell line
name: cell_line

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

schema_type.description: The type of the metadata schema entity.

provenance.description: Provenance information added or generated at time of ingest.
provenance.title: Provenance
provenance.name: provenance

submission_date.description: When project was first submitted to database.

submitter_id.description: ID of individual who first submitted project.

updater_id.description: ID of individual who last updated project.

document_id.comment: This structure supports the current ingest API. It may change in the future.

accession.description: A unique accession for this entity, provided by the broker.

biomaterial_core.description: Information about any biological material that was generated/used in the project including everything from a whole organism to subcellular components.
biomaterial_core.title: Biomaterial core
biomaterial_core.name: biomaterial_core

biomaterial_id.description: A unique ID for the biomaterial.

biomaterial_name.description: A short, descriptive name for the biomaterial that need not be unique.

biomaterial_description.description: A general description of the biomaterial.

supplementary_files.description: A list of filenames of biomaterial-level supplementary files.

biosd_biomaterial.guidelines: Enter ID if sample has been archived. ID can be from the DDBJ, NCBI, or EMBL-EBI and must start with SAMD, SAMN, or SAME, respectively.

insdc_biomaterial.description: An International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) sample accession.
insdc_biomaterial.guidelines: Enter accession if sample has been archived. Accession can be from the DDBJ, NCBI, or EMBL-EBI and must start with DRS, SRS, or ERS, respecitvely.

supplier.description: The supplier of the cell line.

catalog_number.description: The supplier catalogue number for the cell line.

lot_number.description: The supplier lot or batch number for the cell line.

catalog_url.description: The supplier catalogue URL for the cell line.

cell_cycle.description: A term that may be associated with a cell cycle-related ontology term
cell_cycle.title: Cell cycle ontology
cell_cycle.name: cell_cycle_ontology

text.description: The name of a cell cycle of the cells in the specimen.
text.example: meiotic cell cycle; mitotic G1 phase

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field
ontology_label.example: meiotic cell cycle; mitotic G1 phase

cell_line_type.example: Should be one of: primary, immortalized, stem cell, stem cell-derived, induced pluripotent, or synthetic.

cell_morphology.description: Information relating to pathological and morphological features of cells.
cell_morphology.title: Cell morphology
cell_morphology.name: cell_morphology

cell_morphology.description: General description of the morphology of cells.
cell_morphology.example: adherent cells; form single layer colonies

cell_size.description: Size of cells in Cell size unit.
cell_size.guidelines: Enter a single value or a range. Average value is acceptable.

cell_size_unit.description: A term that may be associated with a cell type-related ontology term
cell_size_unit.title: Length unit ontology
cell_size_unit.name: length_unit_ontology

text.description: The name of a length unit being used.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field

percent_cell_viability.description: Percent of cells determined to be viable.
percent_cell_viability.guidelines: Enter a single number. Average value is acceptable.

cell_viability_method.description: The method by which cell viability was determined.

cell_viability_result.description: Result of the cell viability test.
cell_viability_result.example: Should be one of: pass, fail

percent_necrosis.description: Percent of cells identified to be necrotic.
percent_necrosis.guidelines: Enter a single number. Average value is acceptable.

growth_conditions.description: Information relating to how a biomaterial was grown and/or maintained in a laboratory setting.
growth_conditions.title: Growth conditions
growth_conditions.name: growth_conditions

passage_number.description: The number of passages that the biomaterial has been through.

growth_medium.description: The solid, liquid, or semi-solid medium used to support growth.
growth_medium.example: human placental cord serum; RPMI 1640 + 2mM Glutamine + 10-20% FBS

culture_environment.description: Cell culture environment in which cells are grown.
culture_environment.example: Adherent cell culture; Suspension cell culture

mycoplasma_testing_method.description: The method by which the biomaterial was tested for mycoplasma contamination.
mycoplasma_testing_method.example: Should be one of: Direct DNA stain, Indirect DNA stain, Broth and agar culture, PCR, Nested PCR, ELISA, Autoradiography, Immunostaining, Cell-based assay, or Microbiological assay.

mycoplasma_testing_results.description: Whether the biomaterial passed or failed the mycoplasma test.
mycoplasma_testing_results.example: Should be one of: pass, or fail.

drug_treatment.description: Description of drugs added to the growth medium.
drug_treatment.guidelines: Provide the drug name and concentration with units. List multiple drugs separated by commas.

feeder_layer_type.description: Type of feeder layer cells on which biomaterial was grown.
enum: feeder-dependent, mouse bone marrow stromal cells
feeder-dependent, mouse yolk sac-derived endothelial cells
feeder-dependent, human fetal lung fibroblast cells
feeder-dependent, human umbilical cord stromal cells
feeder-dependent, human fetal liver stromal cells
feeder-dependent, human fallopian tubal epithelial cells
feeder_layer_type.example: feeder-free; feeder-dependent, mouse embryonic fibroblast cells

confluency.description: The percent a plate surface is covered by cells.

cell_type.description: A term that may be associated with a cell type-related ontology term
cell_type.title: Cell type ontology
cell_type.name: cell_type_ontology

text.description: The name of a cell type supplied by a user.
text.example: bone marrow hematopoietic cell; cardiac muscle cell

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field
ontology_label.example: bone marrow hematopoietic cell; cardiac muscle cell

karyotype.description: The karyotype of the cell line.
karyotype.example: sex chromosome complement of XY, del(2) (q11)

tissue.description: A term that may be associated with an anatomy-related ontology term
tissue.title: Organ part ontology
tissue.name: organ_part_ontology

text.description: The text for the term as the user provides it.

ontology.description: A term for a specific part of an organ from the ontology [UBERON](https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/uberon).

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field

date_established.description: When the cell line was established.
date_established.guidelines: Enter the date established in date format: yyyy-mm-dd.

disease.description: A term that may be associated with a disease-related ontology term
disease.title: Disease ontology
disease.name: disease_ontology

text.description: The text for the term as the user provides it.

ontology.description: An optional ontology reference in format where prefix_ indicates which ontology

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field

genus_species.description: The scientific binomial name for the species of the cell line.

items.description: A term that may be associated with a species-related ontology term
items.title: Species ontology
items.name: species_ontology

text.description: The name of the species to which the organism belongs.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field

publication.description: Information about a journal article, book, web page, or other external available documentation for a project.
publication.title: Publication
publication.name: publication

authors.description: A list of authors associated with the publication.
authors.guidelines: List each author in 'surname initials' format.

publication_title.example: Study of single cells in the human body.

doi.description: The publication digital object identifier (doi) of the publication.

pmid.description: The PubMed ID of the publication.
